sentence: Wall Street made a stronger start to the holiday-shortened trading week, with investors shrugging off last week's losses and geopolitical worries as telecoms and financials led gains.

Volumes were below average ahead of Thanksgiving on Thursday and a truncated session Friday, but a majority of the sectors on the S&P 500 ended in the green while the Dow Jones Industrial Average saw nearly two thirds of its blue chips rise, led by Verizon ( VZ ) and Home Depot ( HD ).
The Nasdaq Composite was more subdued, constrained by losses in its health names.
